content:
To make your support processes more accurate, define when your support team is available to help customers. There are a few guidelines to keep in mind as you set business hours.

Available in: Salesforce Classic, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions.

After you set business hours, add the Business Hours lookup field to case layouts and set field-level security on the Business Hours field. This lets users view and update the business hours on a case.

Business hours on a case are automatically set to your organization's default business hours, unless the case matches the criteria on an escalation rule associated with different business hours. Salesforce automatically calculates daylight savings times for the time zones available for business hours.

Business hours on a case include hours, minutes, and seconds. However, if business hours are less than 24 hours, the system ignores the seconds for the last minute before business hours end.

Escalation rules only run during the business hours theyâ€™re associated with. You can update cases associated with business hours that are no longer active without having to reactivate business hours.

You can create multiple business hours for support teams that operate in the same time zone but at different hours. For simplicity, we recommend that you create one set of business hours per support center.

Escalation rules must be removed from a set of business hours before they can be deactivated. Up to 1000 holidays can be associated with each set of business hours.

Business hours are applied according to a hierarchy on cases that include entitlements. On cases without entitlements, business hours are applied as specified in the escalation rule.
title: Guidelines for Setting Business Hours in Service Cloud
